content: Great, and sobering, piece. It’s important for us to recognize that this situation has not just been created out of blind spots and hubris among “coastal elites” (including people like you and me) but also as part of a deliberate political strategy by major actors in our society. Undermining trust in authority has a long history in the US (think of Hofstadter writing about this in Anti-intellectualism in American Life). We’re seeing it at tremendous scale now. Part of the solution might involve less emphasis on “proving” we’re right on a particular issue, and more of exposing contradictions and hypocrisy among the sources of false info. The frame in trying to persuade people who believe things that are not true should be more “you’re being conned and I believe you’d want you to learn about that” and perhaps less “you’re stupid and you’re wrong.”
